definition: lit. to take different roads and urge the horses on (idiom)/fig. to part ways
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
horsebit/variant of 鏢|镖[biao1]

sentences.english: From this place the party again diverged , according to their several fancies.
sentences.chinese: 這夥人根據各自的愛好，又從這裏分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: citing irreconcilable differences, one party will jilt the other sooner rather than later.
sentences.chinese: 無法調解的分歧很快就會使兩黨分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: We parted wishing each other well.
sentences.chinese: 我們雙方只能在互道祝福後分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: Later in the evolution of whale hearing, the toothed and baleen whales parted ways.
sentences.chinese: 鯨豚聽覺的演化到了後期，齒鯨與鬚鯨就分道揚鑣了。

sentences.english: Horrified , Mr Chanes de Armas first punched him, then drifted away.
sentences.chinese: 震驚之餘，阿馬斯第一次開始抨擊他，然後分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: Dodonna and Tallon parted ways, with both going into hiding.
sentences.chinese: 多登納和塔隆分道揚鑣，都轉入地下。

sentences.english: In a negatively curved, saddle-shaped universe, parallel beams would diverge.
sentences.chinese: 如果宇宙呈馬鞍形反向彎曲，平行光線就會分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: Finally, we went our separate ways.
I guess the only thing to do now is call a halt to this negotiation and part, friend.
sentences.chinese: 我想如今專一能做的便是制止會商，然後分道揚鑣吧。

sentences.english: The two sides agreed not to criticize each other and went separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 雙方達成一致，絕不相互指責，繼而分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: But then our visions of the future began to diverge and eventually we had a falling-out.
sentences.chinese: 可是我們對未來的願景不同，最後只好分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: Sun Yat-sen and Chen Jiongming soon split over the continuation of the Northern Expedition.
sentences.chinese: 孫逸仙和陳炯明不久就因繼續北伐的事宜而分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: Its open approach will be what sets the company apart from Microsoft.
sentences.chinese: 其開放的解決方案令其與微軟分道揚鑣。

sentences.english: We may as well exchange good-by and go separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 我們還是互道再見，分道揚鑣吧。

sentences.english: Then they go their separate ways.
sentences.chinese: 然後他們就分道揚鑣了。

definition: to rupture/to burst open/to break/to break off relations with/a rupture
to die peacefully/(fig.) to result in failure (without any outside interference)/to come to nothing/to fizzle out
to have a falling out/to have a big argument
stuck together as by glue (of lovers)/joined at the hip
fuse (for explosives)/(fig.) proximate cause/the last straw
close relation, no gap (idiom); intimate and nothing can come between
to remain unmoved
to go separate ways (idiom)/to part ways with sb/Taiwan pr. [ge4 ben1 dong1 xi1]
to disagree/dissent
to vanish/to disappear from the face of the earth
not to hear, not to question (idiom)/to show no interest in sth/uncritical/not in the least concerned
ironclad evidence/conclusive proof
(idiom) due to an unexpected turn of events
to question intensely/to interrogate/to demand information
to part on bad terms/(of a meeting etc) to break up in discord
bruised/riddled with scars
